title: Missing models or meshes should result in an error message not a silently hanging gazebo

content.raw:
This bug - at least I would strongly argue it is a bug - has been around for quite a while.
However, since I just wasted, again(!), a lot of time due to this bug, here we go:

If an SDF references a non-existing meshes gazebo simply hangs indefinitely without reporting any error, not even on the command line.
The same is true if a WORLD file <includes> a non-existing model, gazebo will hang on startup  with a black 3D screen - one has a really hard time figuring out what is the reason for this behavior.

Suggested change:
Gazebo should behave like rviz. If a referenced mesh or included model is missing, report an error that says exactly that and continue without mesh/model.
